div.head:
BARNUM'S
AMERICAN MUSEUM
div.ab:
PERFORMANCES
AFTERNOON & EVENING
SECOND WEEK
Of the EXTRAORDINARY ATTRACTIVE Domestic Drama of
NEIGHBOR
JACKWOOD
The Success of which is truly
Brilliant beyond all Parallel
And the interest of which
SURPASSES IN POWER AND INTENSITY
Everything in the History of the Modern Stage.
THIS
AFTERNOON & EVENING
One of the most
Thrilling Life Stories
EVER PRESENTED.
WEDNESDAY
May 13th, 1857.
This Afternoon at 2 1/2 o'clock,
(Instead of 3, on account of the length of the performance.) and also this
Evening at 7 1/2 o'clock,
The new domestic Drama, in five acts, by J. T. Trowbridge, Esq., entitled
NEIGHBOR
JACKWOOD

New Scenery Incidental to the Piece.
Farmer Jackwood's Kitchen. Exterior of New England Farm House
and Yard. The Interval. The Interval Inundated. Interior of a Country
Jail. Interior of the Court House.

div.head: BARNUM'S AMERICAN MUSEUM
div.ab:
Cor. Broadway and Ann St., opposite St. Paul's Church:
Admittance to the whole Museum, the Picture Gallery, the Natural History Department, the Happy
Family, and the Cosmorama Room, as well as the Entertainments in the Lecture Room..25 Cents
Children under 10 years.........12 1-2 Cents. Seats in the Parquet and First Balcony..One Shilling extra
MORNING VISITORS ADMITTED TO THE AFTERNOON PERFORMANCES FREE.
THE NEW
MANAGEMENT
Feel it a duty to express their gratitude at
The Remarkable Success
Which has attended, for the past twelve-month, their endeavors to provide for an appreciative
public, a
PLACE OF INTELLECTUAL ENTERTAINMENT
Worthy of the general approbation, and one that should commend itself to the popular regard, as well
for its
SPIRIT OF PUBLIC ENTERPRISE
AS FOR THE
NOVELTY AND AMUSEMENT
Characteristic of its peculiar performances. It is a satisfaction to be able conscientiously to add, that
the Museum, during the year 1856, was attended by
Over half a Million of Visitors
A patronage, which, it is thought, has not been surpassed, if equalled by that of any place of similar resort for pastime in the
world. As every Dollar of
THE PROFIT HAS BEEN EXPENDED
IN IMPROVEMENTS
Upon the Establishment itself—in perfecting the details of its business,
INCREASING ITS ATTRACTIONS
In every possible manner—in maintaining
A Prodigal Supply of Curiosities
Both Living and Inanimate—In searching for the Four Quarters of the Globe for every thing UNIQUE AND INTERESTING,
worthy of purchase and preservation, the Management conceives that the
UNPARALLELED PROSPERITY
of
THE MUSEUM
May be regarded, not only as a compliment to their own judgement, and to the taste of their visitors, but as a guaruntee of their
unswerving determination to merit the flattering favors they enjoy.

The size of the Serpent that tempted Eve may be gathered, instructively, from the
SEA-SERPENT LIKE SNAKE
That among the crowd of Anacondas and Boa Constrictors of enormous proportion in the
Den of Living Reptiles
to be seen here, stretches forth like Milton's Monster, who

lg.l: Lay floating many a rood ; in bulk as large
Titanian, or Earth-born that warr'd on Jove,
Briæros or Typhon, whom the den
By ancient Tarsus held, or that sea beast
Leviathan, which God of all his works

div.ab:
THESE SERPENTS
EAT LIVING ANIMALS BEFORE THE VISITORS
when they feed, and the process of deglutiton with them, is one of ht emost marvellous in existence.
THE HAPPY FAMILY
Which is too well known to be described,
